edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.GameEngine

  • public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    The Game Engine class will be used to keep track of the status of the game, whether it has been completed or not. It also provides the medium between the Grid and the UI.
    Author:
    Richard Pham, Oakar Kyaw, Ethan Liao, Jeremy Anunwah, Bennett Wong.

    • Field Detail

      • SAVE_FILE

        private final java.lang.String SAVE_FILE
        This field represents the save file of the game. This is what will be used when the user wants to save at a certain point of the game.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • board

        private Grid board
        This field represents the board. The board will initially be set to null.

      • gameDone

        private boolean gameDone
        This field represents whether the game has been completed.

    • Method Detail

      • drawBoard

        public java.lang.String drawBoard(boolean debugMode)
        This method will draw the board out so that the user will be able to see it, depending on whether the parameter is true or false.
        Parameters:
        debugMode - determines whether the board is drawn or not.

      • getDebugMode

        public boolean getDebugMode()
        This method returns whether or not the debug mode is turned on or off.
        Returns:
        whether or not the debug mode is on

      • saveGame

        public java.lang.String saveGame()
        Save the game.
        Returns:
        A status string.

      • loadGame

        public java.lang.String loadGame()
        Load some game save data.
        Returns:
        A status string.

      • gameOver

        public boolean gameOver()
        This method will return whether the game has been finished or not.
        Returns:
        whether the game is complete.

      • movePlayerUp

        public int movePlayerUp()
        This method calls the method in the Grid to move the player in the 'up' direction. Additionally, it returns the integer value corresponding to what the player encounters.
        Returns:
        integer corresponding to what the player encounters or doesn't encounter

      • movePlayerDown

        public int movePlayerDown()
        This method calls the method in the Grid to move the player in the 'down' direction. Additionally, it returns the integer value corresponding to what the player encounters. If the method returns '6' as an integer value, then the player has found the briefcase.
        Returns:
        integer corresponding to what the player encounters or doesn't encounter

      • movePlayerLeft

        public int movePlayerLeft()
        This method calls the method in the Grid to move the player in the 'left' direction. Additionally, it returns the integer value corresponding to what the player encounters.
        Returns:
        integer corresponding to what the player encounters or doesn't encounter

      • movePlayerRight

        public int movePlayerRight()
        This method calls the method in the Grid to move the player in the 'right' direction. Additionally, it returns the integer value corresponding to what the player encounters.
        Returns:
        integer corresponding to what the player encounters or doesn't encounter

      • moveEnemies

        public boolean moveEnemies()
        This method calls the method in the Grid to move the ninjas. Additionally, it returns a boolean value that returns true if the player has been killed due to the ninja's movement.
        Returns:
        whether or not the player has been killed

      • shootUp

        public boolean shootUp()
        This method calls the method in the Grid to shoot in the 'up' direction. Additionally, it returns a boolean value that returns true if the player has killed a ninja.
        Returns:
        whether or not a player has killed a ninja.

      • shootDown

        public boolean shootDown()
        This method calls the method in the Grid to shoot in the 'down' direction. Additionally, it returns a boolean value that returns true if the player has killed a ninja.
        Returns:
        whether or not a player has killed a ninja.

      • shootLeft

        public boolean shootLeft()
        This method calls the method in the Grid to shoot in the 'left' direction. Additionally, it returns a boolean value that returns true if the player has killed a ninja.
        Returns:
        whether or not a player has killed a ninja.

      • shootRight

        public boolean shootRight()
        This method calls the method in the Grid to shoot in the 'right' direction. Additionally, it returns a boolean value that returns true if the player has killed a ninja.
        Returns:
        whether or not a player has killed a ninja.

      • setAmmo

        public void setAmmo(int bullet)
        This method calls the method in the Grid to set the amount of ammo in the player's gun to the integer value that is passed into the parameter.
        Parameters:
        bullet - the amount of ammo in the player's gun

      • getInvincTurns

        public int getInvincTurns()
        This method calls the method in the Grid that returns the amount of turns the player is invincible for.
        Returns:
        amount of turns the player is invincible for

      • checkInvincTurns

        public void checkInvincTurns()
        This method calls the method in the Grid that checks if the player is still invincible or not.

      • decreaseInvinc

        public void decreaseInvinc()
        This method calls the method in the Grid to decrease the amount of turns the player has been invincible for.

      • setGogglePosition

        public void setGogglePosition(int firstRow,
                              int firstColumn,
                              int secondRow,
                              int secondColumn)
        This method receives and set the positions the player has used the night vision goggles to look in.
        Parameters:
        firstRow - the row of the first position the player looked in
        firstColumn - the column of the first position the player looked in
        secondRow - the row of the second position the player looked in
        secondColumn - the column of the second position the player looked in

      • getGoggle

        public boolean getGoggle()
        This method returns whether or not the night vision goggles are on or off. If this method returns true, then the night vision goggles are on.
        Returns:
        whether or not the night vision goggles are on or off

      • goggleOn

        public void goggleOn()
        This method calls the method in the Grid to turn on the night vision goggles.

      • goggleOff

        public void goggleOff()
        This method calls the method in the Grid to turn off the night vision goggles.

      • getAmmo

        public int getAmmo()
        This method calls the method in the Grid that returns the amount of ammo in the player's gun
        Returns:
        the amount of ammo in the player's gun

      • getPlayerPositionColumn

        public int getPlayerPositionColumn()
        This method calls the method in the Grid that returns the player's position's column.
        Returns:
        the column of the player's position

      • getPlayerPositionRow

        public int getPlayerPositionRow()
        This method calls the method in the Grid that returns the player's position's row.
        Returns:
        the row of the player's position

      • checkPlayerLives

        public int checkPlayerLives()
        This method calls the method in the Grid that checks if the player still has lives in the game. If the player has zero lives, then the game ends.
        Returns:
        the amount of lives the player has

      • getPlayerLives

        public int getPlayerLives()
        This method returns the amount of lives the player has.
        Returns:
        the amount of lives the player has

      • reset

        public void reset()
        This method resets the game.
